required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sequelae of COVID-19 With Focus on Exercise Capacity and Underlying Mechanisms
clinical_study.official_title: COVID-19 Severity, Long-term Consequences for Exercise Capacity and Link to Associated Mechanisms

brief_summary.textblock: The project is designed as a cross-sectional study and aims to examine middle- to long-term consequences of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) for selected bio-behavioural parameters while taking the disease course severity into account.

primary_outcome.description: Measured during cardiopulmonary exercise testing on a cycle ergometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced expiratory volume in 1 s (as % of predicted)
Diffusion capacity of the lungs (as % of predicted)

secondary_outcome.description: Measured using near-infrared spectroscopy during cardiopulmonary exercise testing on a cycle ergometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac output at peak exercise (in mL)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured non-invasive using the PhysioFlow device during cardiopulmonary exercise testing on a cycle ergometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Handgrip rate of force development (in N/s)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 to 14 days after inclusion in study
2 to 14 days after inclusion in study
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 5 to 50 with higher scores indicating more severe fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Score of depression, anxiety, and stress questionnaire (DASS21)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 to 14 days after inclusion in study
secondary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 63 with higher scores indicating worse mental health.
The statistical (Mahalanobis) distance (health distance) is a composite measure of various health biomarkers

arm_group.description: Individuals with a positive severe acute respiratory syndrome-novel coronavirus-2 (SARS-nCOV-2) antigen-/polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the last 12 months that required hospitalisation in a normal ward. Symptoms typically worsened within a period of 5 to 10 days leading to e.g., prolonged fever, feeling of sickness and/or shortness of breath.

Individuals with a positive SARS-nCOV-2 antigen-/PCR test within the last 12 months that required hospitalisation in an intensive care ward. Additionally, patients hospitalised in a normal ward but requiring nasal high flow therapy or >4 L/min of oxygen administration.

Individuals with a positive SARS-nCOV-2 antigen-/PCR test within the last 18 months that required hospitalisation in a normal ward. Symptoms typically worsened within a period of 5 to 10 days leading to e.g., prolonged fever, feeling of sickness and/or shortness of breath.

Individuals with a positive SARS-nCOV-2 antigen-/PCR test within the last 18 months that required hospitalisation in an intensive care ward. Additionally, patients hospitalised in a normal ward but requiring nasal high flow therapy or >4 L/min of oxygen administration.

Individuals with a positive SARS-nCOV-2 antigen-/PCR test within the last 24 months that required hospitalisation in a normal ward. Symptoms typically worsened within a period of 5 to 10 days leading to e.g., prolonged fever, feeling of sickness and/or shortness of breath.

Individuals with a positive SARS-nCOV-2 antigen-/PCR test within the last 24 months that required hospitalisation in an intensive care ward. Additionally, patients hospitalised in a normal ward but requiring nasal high flow therapy or >4 L/min of oxygen administration.
Age- and sex-matched (frequency matching), fully vaccinated individuals with no history of SARS-nCOV-2 infection. The latter will be verified via virological blood biomarkers wherever possible.

intervention.description: Handgrip strength test, mid-thigh pull test and standing balance test in static tandem stance

intervention.intervention_name: Micro- and macrovascular endothelial function and cardiac function
intervention.description: Measurement of flow-mediated dilation, static and dynamic retinal vessel analysis, echocardiography

Global physical activity questionnaire (GPAQ), short-form 8 health survey (SF-8), barriers to physical activity, fatigue assessment scale (FAS), modified medical research council dyspnea scale (mMRC), depression, anxiety, and stress scale (DASS21), post-COVID-19 syndrome symptoms

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples (total volume 15.7 mL) will be collected by venipuncture of the cubital fossa, are subsequently centrifuged and the plasma aliquots are frozen at -80°C.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients recovering from moderate or severe COVID-19 and fully vaccinated controls with no history of COVID-19.
Recruitment of patients will be done via the University Hospital of Basel, Switzerland, the Clinic Barmelweid, Barmelweid, Switzerland, and Cantonal Hospital Olten,Olten, Switzerland. Participants for the control group will be recruited prospectively thru the COVID-19 testing center at the University Hospital of Basel (individuals that received a negative SARS-nCOV-2 test result), unaddressed letters distributed in the Basel-Stadt area, newspaper, internet-based media, and word-of-mouth. Recruitment will continue until the number of valid datasets corresponds to the calculated sample size.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- tested positive for SARS-nCOV-2 using antigen- or PCR tests within the last 24 months
- previous hospitalization due to COVID-19
- fully vaccinated (only for controls)
Exclusion Criteria:
- inability to follow the study procedures (e.g. due to language barriers, psychological disorders, dementia, etc.),
- known pregnancy or lactating women,
- presence of any contraindications for exercising until maximum exhaustion, including insufficient blood pressure control (systolic >170 mmHg, diastolic >100 mmHg), ongoing cancer treatment, unstable angina pectoris, uncontrolled bradyarrhythmia or tachyarrhythmia, severe uncorrected valvular heart disease, clinically relevant acute infection, any form of musculoskeletal injury,
- participating in any interventional clinical trial within the last four weeks,
- previous participation in the current study
- history of COVID-19 (only for controls)

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Sport, Exercise and Health, University of Basel, Basel, Switzerland

facility.name: Division of Sports and Exercise Medicine, Department of Sport, Exercise and Health, University of Basel

responsible_party.investigator_title: Sponsor-Investigator and Head of Rehabilitative and Regenerative Sports Medicine, Department of Sport, Exercise and Health
